data.note: 2026-01-16 20:35 - Review: Favicon added at internal/tickboard/server/static/favicon.svg. Check that the icon matches the Catppuccin Mocha design aesthetic - dark base (#1e1e2e) with rosewater checkmark (#f5e0dc). View in browser tab to verify visibility and clarity at 16x16 pixels.

Please verify: (1) the icon displays correctly in browser tabs, (2) the dark base background (#1e1e2e) and rosewater checkmark (#f5e0dc) match the Catppuccin Mocha aesthetic, (3) the checkmark is visible and clear at 16x16 pixel size.
data.title: Favico for Tick Board

data.reason: Updated workflow state labels for clarity: 'Needs Content' → 'Needs review (content)', 'Needs Review' → 'Needs review (code)', 'Needs Approval' → 'Needs approval'. Changed in both app.js formatRequires() function and index.html dropdown options.
data.title: tickboard workflow states

data.note: 2026-01-16 20:37 - Completed workflow label changes. Updated formatRequires() in app.js and dropdown in index.html. The test failures in the test run were pre-existing and unrelated to this change (missing ColumnBacklog/ColumnInput/ColumnReview constants and cloud client config issues).
data.title: tickboard workflow states

data.reason: Added secondary sort by tick ID in app.js to ensure stable ordering when priorities are equal. The issue was that LoadTicksParallel loads ticks concurrently with non-deterministic order, and the frontend sort only used priority which caused reordering for ticks with same priority.
data.title: tick board: explore spontaneous reordering

data.note: 2026-01-16 20:39 - Fixed by adding secondary sort by tick ID in app.js renderTicks(). Root cause: LoadTicksParallel uses concurrent goroutines with non-deterministic completion order, and frontend only sorted by priority. Now sorts by priority first, then by ID for ties. Commit: 935953f
data.title: tick board: explore spontaneous reordering

data.reason: Created DOMAIN_SETUP.md with comprehensive instructions for setting up custom domain (tickboard.io) for Cloudflare Worker. Updated wrangler.toml with commented route configuration. Actual domain registration and Cloudflare DNS setup requires manual action.
data.title: Set up real domain for tickboard cloud

data.note: 2026-01-16 20:41 - Created DOMAIN_SETUP.md with comprehensive instructions for setting up tickboard.io domain. The Go client already has DefaultCloudURL = wss://tickboard.io/agent, so once the domain is configured in Cloudflare, everything will work. Manual steps needed: 1) Register/purchase domain, 2) Add to Cloudflare, 3) Configure DNS records, 4) Uncomment routes in wrangler.toml, 5) Deploy. Consider using Cloudflare's 'Custom Domains' feature for simpler setup.
data.title: Set up real domain for tickboard cloud

data.reason: Added DELETE /api/boards/:boardId endpoint with auth validation. Backend deleteBoard() in auth.ts performs SQL DELETE with user ownership check. Frontend adds remove button on board items (appears on hover, turns red) with confirmation dialog. Board list refreshes after removal. Non-destructive - boards can reconnect later.
data.title: Cloud: Allow removing boards from dashboard list

data.note: 2026-01-16 20:50 - Implemented board removal feature. Key points: (1) DELETE endpoint validates user ownership before deleting, (2) Removal is non-destructive - agents can reconnect and re-register the board, (3) UI shows remove button only on hover to avoid accidental clicks, (4) Confirmation dialog warns user that board can reconnect later.
data.title: Cloud: Allow removing boards from dashboard list

data.reason: Added dedicated 'Human-Only Tasks (awaiting=work)' section to tk top-level help with clear explanation and examples for creating/updating tasks with --awaiting work, how they're skipped by agent queues, and how to return them to agent queue
data.title: Document awaiting=work in tk top-level help
want ability to reopen a closed tick
want ability to reopen a closed tick

data.reason: Configured tickboard.dev custom domain using Cloudflare Workers custom domains feature. Updated: 1) wrangler.toml with custom_domain routes for tickboard.dev and www.tickboard.dev, 2) Go client DefaultCloudURL from tickboard.io to tickboard.dev, 3) DOMAIN_SETUP.md documentation. Deployed worker successfully - DNS resolves to Cloudflare IPs (188.114.97.12/188.114.96.12) and health endpoint responds correctly.
data.title: Set up real domain for tickboard cloud

data.note: 2026-01-16 21:03 - Domain tickboard.dev is now live. Worker deployed with custom_domain feature which auto-manages DNS. Both tickboard.dev and www.tickboard.dev route to the worker. Updated ~/.tickboardrc locally to use new URL. Note: Some tests fail due to pre-existing issues (TestLoadConfig_NoToken doesn't account for existing config file, server tests reference undefined constants) - not caused by this change.
data.title: Set up real domain for tickboard cloud
